711138f-a.title: Manhattan: 12th Street - 8th Avenue
711138f-a.text:
(1)
12th Street (fomwrly Troy Street), west from Eighth Avenue,
at Abingdon Square. On the north side, the Jeffersonisn
Club, at 301-303 West 12th Street, is flying its flaga.
The six-atory building on the S.W. corner of 12th and Hudson
Streets, flying ita flag, is Laura Spellman Hall Y. W. C. A.
May 30, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
NEG ~ E5R
(2)
The same, but not showing No. 297 West 12th, which still stands,
after demolition of Nos. 299-309. Nos. 6ll-6l9 Hudson Street,
on the west side, are thus disclosed.
September 21, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

710063f-b.title: Manhattan: 8th Avenue - 12th Street (West)
710063f-b.text:
Eighth Avenue, north from W. 12th Street. The dominant County
Trust Company Building is in its final stares. TRis is at the N. E.
corner of 14th Street. W. 12th Strent is on the rirht. The view on
the north side of same extends enstward to W. 14th Street. This forms
the base of a triangular block. Note the Bing and Bing sign at the
margin, announcing the proposeo construction of a tall apartment house
at the S. E. corner. This new structure, No. 20 Abingdon Square, appears
partially in the later view.
View 1: May 27, 1930
View 2: March 9, 1933
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

710062f-a.title: Manhattan: 8th Avenue - 12th Street (West)
710062f-a.text:
Eighth Avenue, north fror W. 12th Street. View 2 is the sare
area several years later, showing in addition at 14th Street, the

October 1, 1928

710900f-a.title: Manhattan: 8th Avenue - 12th Street
710900f-a.text:
Eighth Avenue, west side, north from W. 12th to Jane Streets.
At the left margin is a portion of a building that will be included
in a new apartment house site. This is to be the towering No. 299
West 12th Street Building.
March 8, 1929
P. L. Sperr
NO REEODUCTINS

711149f-a.title: Manhattan: 12th Street (West) - 8th Avenue
711149f-a.text:
303-301 West 12th Street (north side of Abingdon Sduare), between

Democratic Organization, Thind Aseembly District South.
March 8, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

711157f-a.title: Manhattan: 12th Street (West) - 8th Avenue
711157f-a.text:
West 12th Street, north side, from Eighth Avenue (right)
to Hudson Street (left), showing aoross Abingdon Scuare,
the 20 story apartment house, No. 299 West 12th Street.
This massive building occupies the major portion of this
frontage, excluding the small corner plot at the right.
It was completed in June of 1931. Protuding beyond is
the Port Authority Bldg. The photographers vantage point
is at Bank Street.
May 12, 1940
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
